title: Authors and Citation
text: Matsumura T (2024). ensumr: Analyse Enquate Data Easily. R package version 0.5.0, https://matutosi.github.io/ensumr/, https://github.com/matutosi/ensumr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ensumr: Analyse Enquate Data Easily},   author = {Toshikazu Matsumura},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.5.0, https://matutosi.github.io/ensumr/},   url = {https://github.com/matutosi/ensumr}, }

title: Analyse Enquate Data Easily
text: goal ensumr analyse enquate data easily.

title: Analyse Enquate Data Easily
text: can install development version ensumr GitHub :

title: Analyse Enquate Data Easily
text: can use dummy data. can show summary enquate enq_summary(). can analyse item enq_simple(), can used singular multiple options. column name “_ord”, result arranged options. Otherwise, results arranged counted numbers. multiple options separated deliminator (default “;”). can analyse two item (cross tabulation) enq_cross().
code: library(ensumr) dummy_data #> # A tibble: 50 × 4 #>    q1    q2_ord    q3_multi    q4_comment                                        #>    <chr> <fct>     <chr>       <chr>                                             #>  1 u     never     "A;B;C;D;E" The odor of spring makes young hearts jump.       #>  2 j     often     "E"         The goose was brought straight from the old mark… #>  3 m     rarely    "B;C;D"     A young child should not suffer fright.           #>  4 n     often     "C;D"       Mark the spot with a sign painted red.            #>  5 x     sometimes "A;D"       Plead with the lawyer to drop the lost cause.     #>  6 d     never     "A;B;C;D;E" The fight will end in just six minutes.           #>  7 c     rarely    "A;B;C;D;E" The three story house was built of stone.         #>  8 y     rarely    ""          Time brings us many changes.                      #>  9 b     rarely    "A;B;C;D;E" Whitings are small fish caught in nets.           #> 10 b     rarely    "A;B;D;E"   The baby puts his right foot in his mouth.        #> # ℹ 40 more rows enq_summary(dummy_data) #> $q1 #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    q1        n #>    <chr> <int> #>  1 b         6 #>  2 c         4 #>  3 m         4 #>  4 n         4 #>  5 u         4 #>  6 j         3 #>  7 r         3 #>  8 s         3 #>  9 a         2 #> 10 g         2 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #>  #> $q2_ord #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   q2_ord        n #>   <fct>     <int> #> 1 always        4 #> 2 often        10 #> 3 sometimes    12 #> 4 rarely       14 #> 5 never        10 #>  #> $q3_multi #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   q3_multi     n #>   <chr>    <int> #> 1 "A"         32 #> 2 "B"         24 #> 3 "D"         24 #> 4 "C"         23 #> 5 "E"         21 #> 6 ""           8 enq_summary(dummy_data, simplify = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 32 × 3 #>    item  option     n #>    <chr> <chr>  <int> #>  1 q1    b          6 #>  2 q1    c          4 #>  3 q1    m          4 #>  4 q1    n          4 #>  5 q1    u          4 #>  6 q1    j          3 #>  7 q1    r          3 #>  8 q1    s          3 #>  9 q1    a          2 #> 10 q1    g          2 #> # ℹ 22 more rows enq_simple(dummy_data, "q1") #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    q1        n #>    <chr> <int> #>  1 b         6 #>  2 c         4 #>  3 m         4 #>  4 n         4 #>  5 u         4 #>  6 j         3 #>  7 r         3 #>  8 s         3 #>  9 a         2 #> 10 g         2 #> # ℹ 11 more rows enq_simple(dummy_data, "q2_ord") #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   q2_ord        n #>   <fct>     <int> #> 1 always        4 #> 2 often        10 #> 3 sometimes    12 #> 4 rarely       14 #> 5 never        10 enq_simple(dummy_data, "q3_multi") #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   q3_multi     n #>   <chr>    <int> #> 1 "A"         32 #> 2 "B"         24 #> 3 "D"         24 #> 4 "C"         23 #> 5 "E"         21 #> 6 ""           8 enq_cross(dummy_data, "q1", "q2_ord") #> # A tibble: 21 × 7 #>    q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely q2_ord_never #>    <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int>        <int> #>  1 b                 0            0                1             5            0 #>  2 c                 1            1                0             1            1 #>  3 m                 0            0                1             2            1 #>  4 n                 0            3                1             0            0 #>  5 u                 0            0                1             1            2 #>  6 j                 0            1                1             1            0 #>  7 r                 1            0                0             1            1 #>  8 s                 0            1                1             1            0 #>  9 a                 0            0                1             0            1 #> 10 g                 0            1                0             0            1 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: total <int> enq_cross(dummy_data, "q1", "q3_multi") #> # A tibble: 21 × 8 #>    q1    q3_multi_ q3_multi_A q3_multi_B q3_multi_C q3_multi_D q3_multi_E total #>    <chr>     <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int> <int> #>  1 b             0          6          4          3          4          4    21 #>  2 u             0          4          2          3          4          2    15 #>  3 c             1          3          3          2          2          3    14 #>  4 m             0          3          3          2          2          2    12 #>  5 g             0          2          2          1          1          2     8 #>  6 n             1          2          1          2          1          1     8 #>  7 l             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #>  8 s             1          1          1          1          1          1     6 #>  9 t             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #> 10 a             1          1          1          1          1          0     5 #> # ℹ 11 more rows enq_cross(dummy_data, "q2_ord", "q3_multi", arrange_total = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 5 × 8 #>   q2_ord  q3_multi_ q3_multi_A q3_multi_B q3_multi_C q3_multi_D q3_multi_E total #>   <fct>       <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int> <int> #> 1 always          1          3          1          2          1          2    10 #> 2 often           3          3          3          5          4          4    22 #> 3 someti…         2          9          3          6          5          4    29 #> 4 rarely          2         10         10          6          7          6    41 #> 5 never           0          7          7          4          7          5    30 enq_cross_split(dummy_data, "q1", "q2_ord", "q3_multi") #> [[1]] #> # A tibble: 8 × 6 #>   q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely total #>   <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int> <int> #> 1 a                 0            0                1             0     1 #> 2 c                 1            0                0             0     1 #> 3 j                 0            0                0             1     1 #> 4 n                 0            1                0             0     1 #> 5 p                 0            1                0             0     1 #> 6 q                 0            1                0             0     1 #> 7 s                 0            0                1             0     1 #> 8 y                 0            0                0             1     1 #>  #> $A #> # A tibble: 18 × 7 #>    q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely q2_ord_never #>    <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int>        <int> #>  1 b                 0            0                1             5            0 #>  2 u                 0            0                1             1            2 #>  3 c                 0            1                0             1            1 #>  4 m                 0            0                1             1            1 #>  5 g                 0            1                0             0            1 #>  6 n                 0            1                1             0            0 #>  7 a                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  8 d                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  9 h                 1            0                0             0            0 #> 10 k                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 11 l                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 12 r                 1            0                0             0            0 #> 13 s                 0            0                0             1            0 #> 14 t                 1            0                0             0            0 #> 15 v                 0            0                0             1            0 #> 16 x                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 17 y                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 18 z                 0            0                1             0            0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: total <int> #>  #> $B #> # A tibble: 15 × 7 #>    q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely q2_ord_never #>    <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int>        <int> #>  1 b                 0            0                0             4            0 #>  2 c                 0            1                0             1            1 #>  3 m                 0            0                1             1            1 #>  4 g                 0            1                0             0            1 #>  5 u                 0            0                0             1            1 #>  6 a                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  7 d                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  8 l                 0            0                1             0            0 #>  9 n                 0            1                0             0            0 #> 10 p                 0            0                0             0            1 #> 11 r                 0            0                0             1            0 #> 12 s                 0            0                0             1            0 #> 13 t                 1            0                0             0            0 #> 14 v                 0            0                0             1            0 #> 15 z                 0            0                1             0            0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: total <int> #>  #> $C #> # A tibble: 16 × 7 #>    q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely q2_ord_never #>    <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int>        <int> #>  1 b                 0            0                0             3            0 #>  2 u                 0            0                1             1            1 #>  3 c                 0            1                0             1            0 #>  4 m                 0            0                1             1            0 #>  5 n                 0            2                0             0            0 #>  6 a                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  7 d                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  8 g                 0            1                0             0            0 #>  9 h                 1            0                0             0            0 #> 10 j                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 11 k                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 12 l                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 13 r                 0            0                0             0            1 #> 14 s                 0            1                0             0            0 #> 15 t                 1            0                0             0            0 #> 16 z                 0            0                1             0            0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: total <int> #>  #> $D #> # A tibble: 14 × 7 #>    q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely q2_ord_never #>    <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int>        <int> #>  1 b                 0            0                0             4            0 #>  2 u                 0            0                1             1            2 #>  3 c                 0            0                0             1            1 #>  4 l                 0            0                1             0            1 #>  5 m                 0            0                1             1            0 #>  6 t                 1            1                0             0            0 #>  7 a                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  8 d                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  9 g                 0            1                0             0            0 #> 10 n                 0            1                0             0            0 #> 11 p                 0            0                0             0            1 #> 12 s                 0            1                0             0            0 #> 13 x                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 14 z                 0            0                1             0            0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: total <int> #>  #> $E #> # A tibble: 13 × 7 #>    q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely q2_ord_never #>    <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int>        <int> #>  1 b                 0            0                0             4            0 #>  2 c                 0            1                0             1            1 #>  3 g                 0            1                0             0            1 #>  4 m                 0            0                1             0            1 #>  5 u                 0            0                0             1            1 #>  6 d                 0            0                0             0            1 #>  7 h                 1            0                0             0            0 #>  8 j                 0            1                0             0            0 #>  9 l                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 10 n                 0            0                1             0            0 #> 11 s                 0            1                0             0            0 #> 12 t                 1            0                0             0            0 #> 13 y                 0            0                1             0            0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: total <int> df <- dummy_data bigram <- function(df, col = "", delim = " "){   id <- "id"   "word_1"   df |>     tibble::rownames_to_column(var = id) |>     dplyr::select({{ id }}, contains(col)) |>     tidyr::separate_longer_delim(contains(col), delim = delim) }

title: Analyse Enquate Data Easily
text: Toshikazu Matsumura (2024) ensumr. Analyse Enquate Data Easily. https://github.com/matutosi/ensumr/.

what: Identify character columns in a data frame — chr_cols
title: Identify character columns in a data frame — chr_cols
text: function identifies columns data frame character type.

title: Identify character columns in a data frame — chr_cols
Identify character columns in a data frame — chr_cols
text: df dataframe check character columns. cols optional vector column names check. NULL (default), columns dataframe checked.

title: Identify character columns in a data frame — chr_cols
text: character vector containing names columns dataframe character type.

title: Identify character columns in a data frame — chr_cols
Dummy data for enquete. — dummy_data
text: Dummy data enquete.

title: Dummy data for enquete. — dummy_data
Dummy data for enquete. — dummy_data
text: data frame 50 rows 4 variable: q1 Answers single choice categorical scales. q2_ord Answers single choice ordinal scales. q3_multi Answers multiple choice categorical scales. q4_comment Answers fee descriptive comments.

title: Dummy data for enquete. — dummy_data
code: data(dummy_data) dummy_data #> # A tibble: 50 × 4 #>    q1    q2_ord    q3_multi    q4_comment                                        #>    <chr> <fct>     <chr>       <chr>                                             #>  1 u     never     "A;B;C;D;E" The odor of spring makes young hearts jump.       #>  2 j     often     "E"         The goose was brought straight from the old mark… #>  3 m     rarely    "B;C;D"     A young child should not suffer fright.           #>  4 n     often     "C;D"       Mark the spot with a sign painted red.            #>  5 x     sometimes "A;D"       Plead with the lawyer to drop the lost cause.     #>  6 d     never     "A;B;C;D;E" The fight will end in just six minutes.           #>  7 c     rarely    "A;B;C;D;E" The three story house was built of stone.         #>  8 y     rarely    ""          Time brings us many changes.                      #>  9 b     rarely    "A;B;C;D;E" Whitings are small fish caught in nets.           #> 10 b     rarely    "A;B;D;E"   The baby puts his right foot in his mouth.        #> # ℹ 40 more rows

what: Arrange a data frame based on count, option, or total — enq_arrange
title: Arrange a data frame based on count, option, or total — enq_arrange
text: function arranges data frame count, option, total, depending specified key. uses dplyr::arrange() arranging data. default arrangement descending count ("n").

title: Arrange a data frame based on count, option, or total — enq_arrange
Arrange a data frame based on count, option, or total — enq_arrange
text: df dataframe arranged. key character vector specifying arrangement key. Possible values include: "n": arrange descending count ("n"). "option": arrange first column (assumed option). "total": arrange total column (assumed "total") descending order (requires data frame already "total" column). "default": arrange descending count ("n") first column name contain "_ord", otherwise arrange first column.

title: Arrange a data frame based on count, option, or total — enq_arrange
text: dataframe.

title: Arrange a data frame based on count, option, or total — enq_arrange
code: enq_simple(dummy_data, "q1") |>   print() |>   enq_arrange(key = "option") #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    q1        n #>    <chr> <int> #>  1 b         6 #>  2 c         4 #>  3 m         4 #>  4 n         4 #>  5 u         4 #>  6 j         3 #>  7 r         3 #>  8 s         3 #>  9 a         2 #> 10 g         2 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    q1        n #>    <chr> <int> #>  1 a         2 #>  2 b         6 #>  3 c         4 #>  4 d         1 #>  5 g         2 #>  6 h         1 #>  7 j         3 #>  8 k         1 #>  9 l         2 #> 10 m         4 #> # ℹ 11 more rows enq_simple(dummy_data, "q2_ord") |>   print() |>   enq_arrange(key = "n") #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   q2_ord        n #>   <fct>     <int> #> 1 always        4 #> 2 often        10 #> 3 sometimes    12 #> 4 rarely       14 #> 5 never        10 #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   q2_ord        n #>   <fct>     <int> #> 1 rarely       14 #> 2 sometimes    12 #> 3 often        10 #> 4 never        10 #> 5 always        4 enq_cross(dummy_data, "q1", "q3_multi") |>   print() |>   enq_arrange(key = "total") #> # A tibble: 21 × 8 #>    q1    q3_multi_ q3_multi_A q3_multi_B q3_multi_C q3_multi_D q3_multi_E total #>    <chr>     <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int> <int> #>  1 b             0          6          4          3          4          4    21 #>  2 u             0          4          2          3          4          2    15 #>  3 c             1          3          3          2          2          3    14 #>  4 m             0          3          3          2          2          2    12 #>  5 g             0          2          2          1          1          2     8 #>  6 n             1          2          1          2          1          1     8 #>  7 l             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #>  8 s             1          1          1          1          1          1     6 #>  9 t             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #> 10 a             1          1          1          1          1          0     5 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #> # A tibble: 21 × 8 #>    q1    q3_multi_ q3_multi_A q3_multi_B q3_multi_C q3_multi_D q3_multi_E total #>    <chr>     <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int> <int> #>  1 b             0          6          4          3          4          4    21 #>  2 u             0          4          2          3          4          2    15 #>  3 c             1          3          3          2          2          3    14 #>  4 m             0          3          3          2          2          2    12 #>  5 g             0          2          2          1          1          2     8 #>  6 n             1          2          1          2          1          1     8 #>  7 l             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #>  8 s             1          1          1          1          1          1     6 #>  9 t             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #> 10 a             1          1          1          1          1          0     5 #> # ℹ 11 more rows

what: Create a cross tabulation of counts for two character columns — enq_cross
title: Create a cross tabulation of counts for two character columns — enq_cross
text: function creates cross tabulation counts two character columns data frame. uses tidyr::separate_longer_delim() split columns necessary, dplyr::count() count occurrences combination unique values, tidyr::pivot_wider() reshape data cross tabulation. output arranged values col_1 default. optional total can added using arrange_total() argument.

title: Create a cross tabulation of counts for two character columns — enq_cross
code: enq_cross(df, col_1, col_2, delim = ";", arrange_total = TRUE)  enq_cross_split(df, col_1, col_2, split = NULL, delim = ";")

title: Create a cross tabulation of counts for two character columns — enq_cross
text: df dataframe containing columns used cross tabulation. col_1, col_2, split string name character column used cross tabulation. delim string used delimiter values column (default ";"). arrange_total logical value indicating whether add total. Defaults TRUE.

title: Create a cross tabulation of counts for two character columns — enq_cross
text: data frame cross tabulation counts. first column contains unique values col_1. remaining columns named based col_2 column values prefixed "col_". cell contains count corresponding combination values col_1 col_2. optional total added arrange_total TRUE.

title: Create a cross tabulation of counts for two character columns — enq_cross
code: enq_cross(dummy_data, "q1", "q2_ord") #> # A tibble: 21 × 7 #>    q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely q2_ord_never #>    <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int>        <int> #>  1 b                 0            0                1             5            0 #>  2 c                 1            1                0             1            1 #>  3 m                 0            0                1             2            1 #>  4 n                 0            3                1             0            0 #>  5 u                 0            0                1             1            2 #>  6 j                 0            1                1             1            0 #>  7 r                 1            0                0             1            1 #>  8 s                 0            1                1             1            0 #>  9 a                 0            0                1             0            1 #> 10 g                 0            1                0             0            1 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: total <int> enq_cross(dummy_data, "q1", "q3_multi") #> # A tibble: 21 × 8 #>    q1    q3_multi_ q3_multi_A q3_multi_B q3_multi_C q3_multi_D q3_multi_E total #>    <chr>     <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int> <int> #>  1 b             0          6          4          3          4          4    21 #>  2 u             0          4          2          3          4          2    15 #>  3 c             1          3          3          2          2          3    14 #>  4 m             0          3          3          2          2          2    12 #>  5 g             0          2          2          1          1          2     8 #>  6 n             1          2          1          2          1          1     8 #>  7 l             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #>  8 s             1          1          1          1          1          1     6 #>  9 t             0          1          1          1          2          1     6 #> 10 a             1          1          1          1          1          0     5 #> # ℹ 11 more rows enq_cross(dummy_data, "q2_ord", "q3_multi", arrange_total = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 5 × 8 #>   q2_ord  q3_multi_ q3_multi_A q3_multi_B q3_multi_C q3_multi_D q3_multi_E total #>   <fct>       <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int>      <int> <int> #> 1 always          1          3          1          2          1          2    10 #> 2 often           3          3          3          5          4          4    22 #> 3 someti…         2          9          3          6          5          4    29 #> 4 rarely          2         10         10          6          7          6    41 #> 5 never           0          7          7          4          7          5    30 enq_cross_split(dummy_data, "q1", "q2_ord", "q3_multi") #> [[1]] #> # A tibble: 8 × 6 #>   q1    q2_ord_always q2_ord_often q2_ord_sometimes q2_ord_rarely total #>   <chr>         <int>        <int>            <int>         <int> <int> #> 1 a                 0            0                1             0     1 #> 2 c                 1            0                0             0     1 #> 3 j                 0            0                0             1     1 #> 4 n                 0            1                0             0     1 #> 5 p                 0            1                0             0     1 #> 6 q                 0            1                0             0     1 #> 7 s                 0            0                1             0     1 #> 8 y                 0            0                0             1     1 #>  #> $A #> # what: Count occurrences of values in a column — enq_simple
title: Count occurrences of values in a column — enq_simple
text: function splits values character column delimiter counts occurrences unique value. uses tidyr::separate_longer_delim() split column dplyr::count() count occurrences. order output determined presence "_ord" column name. "_ord" present, output arranged "option", otherwise arranged "n" (number occurrences).

title: Count occurrences of values in a column — enq_simple
Count occurrences of values in a column — enq_simple
text: df dataframe containing column counted. col string column count. delim string used delimiter values column (default ";").

title: Count occurrences of values in a column — enq_simple
text: dataframe two columns: "option" (unique values splitting) "n" (number occurrences unique value).

title: Count occurrences of values in a column — enq_simple
code: enq_simple(dummy_data, "q1") #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    q1        n #>    <chr> <int> #>  1 b         6 #>  2 c         4 #>  3 m         4 #>  4 n         4 #>  5 u         4 #>  6 j         3 #>  7 r         3 #>  8 s         3 #>  9 a         2 #> 10 g         2 #> # ℹ 11 more rows enq_simple(dummy_data, "q2_ord") #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   q2_ord        n #>   <fct>     <int> #> 1 always        4 #> 2 often        10 #> 3 sometimes    12 #> 4 rarely       14 #> 5 never        10 enq_simple(dummy_data, "q3_multi") #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   q3_multi     n #>   <chr>    <int> #> 1 "A"         32 #> 2 "B"         24 #> 3 "D"         24 #> 4 "C"         23 #> 5 "E"         21 #> 6 ""           8

what: Create summaries for multiple character columns in a data frame — enq_summary
title: Create summaries for multiple character columns in a data frame — enq_summary
text: function creates summaries multiple character columns data frame. uses enq_simple calculate occurrences split values column.

title: Create summaries for multiple character columns in a data frame — enq_summary
code: enq_summary(df, cols_except = "_comment$", delim = ";", simplify = FALSE)  enq_summary_bind(df)

title: Create summaries for multiple character columns in a data frame — enq_summary
text: df dataframe containing column counted. cols_except regular expression pattern exclude columns summary. Columns match pattern included. Defaults "_comment$". delim string used delimiter values column (default ";"). simplify logical. TRUE, bind elements list (default FALSE).

title: Create summaries for multiple character columns in a data frame — enq_summary
text: list dataframe. Names list elements column names.

title: Create summaries for multiple character columns in a data frame — enq_summary
code: enq_summary(dummy_data) #> $q1 #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    q1        n #>    <chr> <int> #>  1 b         6 #>  2 c         4 #>  3 m         4 #>  4 n         4 #>  5 u         4 #>  6 j         3 #>  7 r         3 #>  8 s         3 #>  9 a         2 #> 10 g         2 #> # ℹ 11 more rows #>  #> $q2_ord #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   q2_ord        n #>   <fct>     <int> #> 1 always        4 #> 2 often        10 #> 3 sometimes    12 #> 4 rarely       14 #> 5 never        10 #>  #> $q3_multi #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   q3_multi     n #>   <chr>    <int> #> 1 "A"         32 #> 2 "B"         24 #> 3 "D"         24 #> 4 "C"         23 #> 5 "E"         21 #> 6 ""           8 #>  enq_summary(dummy_data, simplify = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 32 × 3 #>    item  option     n #>    <chr> <chr>  <int> #>  1 q1    b          6 #>  2 q1    c          4 #>  3 q1    m          4 #>  4 q1    n          4 #>  5 q1    u          4 #>  6 q1    j          3 #>  7 q1    r          3 #>  8 q1    s          3 #>  9 q1    a          2 #> 10 q1    g          2 #> # ℹ 22 more rows
